text:
Lee J. Cobb (December 8, 1911February 11, 1976) was an American actor. He was best known for his roles in "12 Angry Men", "On the Waterfront", and "The Exorcist". Cobb was born in The Bronx, New York. His daughter, Julie Cobb, was also an actress.
Cobb died in Woodland Hills, California from a heart attack, aged 64.
